<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FINANCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/11/finance-bosses-look-beyond-wall-street-florida?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Finance Joins the 305
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Pitbull" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3o7TKT7gSMOT8Thtss/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Pitbull" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3o7TKT7gSMOT8Thtss/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If recent trends are any indication, bankers will be trading in their Patagonia vests for a flip flop tan. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Ken Moelis, the chairman and CEO of New York investment bank Moelis & Co., <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-11/moelis-gives-his-bankers-blessing-to-work-wherever-they-want?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told Bloomberg</a> he wouldn't stop his employees from moving to Florida.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“We’re a talent business,” he said. “I want to attract, I want to motivate, and I want to retain the greatest talent in the world. And if that talent wants to do it in Florida, that’s where we’ll support them.”</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Moelis’s comments echo a string of other reports that show momentum swinging from the Big Apple to the Big Orange.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Goldman Sachs is </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-06/goldman-plots-florida-base-for-asset-management-in-a-blow-to-nyc?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">scouting out</a></span><span> Florida locations for its asset management arm, Bloomberg wrote last week.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Paul Singer’s hedge fund, Elliott Management, is </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-10-21/singer-s-41-billion-hedge-fund-moving-headquarters-to-florida?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">moving its HQ</a></span><span> to West Palm Beach from Midtown Manhattan, also according to Bloomberg. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Why now? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s not exactly a secret that Florida is warmer than New York, boasts a cheaper cost of living, and has world-class institutions like Publix. But banks have been hesitant to allow their operations to leak out of New York City because physical proximity was considered necessary for dealmaking. Then the pandemic hit, and showed that some parts of finance can be just as easily accomplished on Zoom as in physical boardrooms. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Moelis said his 128 managing directors landed $72 billion of M&A deals since June 30—all without face-to-face meetings. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">It’s not just finance…</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And it’s not just New York bleeding business leaders. In an <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/elon-musk-to-discuss-teslas-banner-year-despite-pandemic-silicon-valleys-future-11607449988?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">interview with the WSJ</a> this week, Tesla CEO Elon Musk confirmed rumors he had moved from California to Texas. Musk said the notoriously expensive Silicon Valley “has too much influence on the world,” and predicted the tech industry would reduce its footprint there. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Right on cue, software giant Oracle said yesterday it was </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/12/11/oracle-is-moving-its-headquarters-from-silicon-valley-to-austin-texas.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">moving its HQ</a></span><span> from Redwood City, CA, to Austin, TX.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>New York and SF have built world-leading business ecosystems. But their dominance could wane thanks to the pandemic’s disruption of office work and Americans’ shifting priorities around quality of life. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PUBLIC HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/11/corporations-across-sectors-prepare-make-distribute-vaccine?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Alright Team, It’s Go Time
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="cargo hold" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMzk2L2NhcmdvX2hvbGQuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>THOMAS COEX/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The impending Covid-19 vaccine rollout will give many sectors across Corporate America the opportunity to shine. Let’s take a quick tour. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Retail: </strong>CVS and Walgreens have been tapped to administer vaccines at tens of thousands of long-term care facilities across the country, and CVS chief Larry Merlo told CNBC his company is “<a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/12/10/cvs-health-has-10000-staffers-ready-to-vaccinate-seniors-at-nursing-homes.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ready to go</a>.” Walmart’s been <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-10/walmart-adds-freezers-dry-ice-to-prepare-for-vaccine-rollout?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">adding</a> cold storage capabilities to handle the vaccine at more than 5,000 of its pharmacies. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Shipping: </strong>FedEx and UPS are carving up the U.S. like a Risk map as they prepare to rush the vaccine to administration sites. They’re <a href="https://www.commercialappeal.com/story/money/industries/logistics/2020/12/10/covid-19-vaccine-latest-fedex-ups-shipping-distribution/3863534001/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">confident</a> that together they have the capacity to deliver both the life-saving shot and the Christmas sweater you sent your aunt. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Pharma: </strong>Turns out, developing a vaccine that can help end a global pandemic can make you a <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/12/11/business/pfizer-vaccine-covid-moderna-revenue/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lot of money</a>. Pfizer and Moderna are expected to generate $32 billion in Covid-19 vaccine sales in 2021, according to Wall Street forecasts. Moderna did just $60 million in revenue last year. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INVESTING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/11/short-sellers-pace-worst-year-ever?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Short Sellers in 2020
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Bro meme" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMzk1L2Jyb19tZW1lLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Real Bros of Simi Valley</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The S&P 500 had its <a href="https://www.freep.com/story/money/business/michigan/2020/12/05/s-p-500-november-its-best-month-history/3824316001/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">best month ever</a> in November, churning out profits for Robinhood traders and institutional heavy-hitters alike. But one cantankerous group of investors got crushed: short sellers. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">A quick refresher: </strong></span><span>Short sellers make money when a company loses value.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This year has been a roller coaster year for the Simon Cowells of the market. In March, when markets crashed, the short fund index posted its <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-11-11/moderna-s-covid-19-shot-is-next-on-deck-after-pfizer-s-success?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">biggest monthly gain ever</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But it’s been nothing but pain ever since. Two of the most popular targets for short sellers, Moderna and Tesla, have gained 702% and 629% this year, respectively, wiping out short sellers’ March profits. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">One approach <em>is</em> working</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Targeting companies like Nikola Motors that have recently gone public via a special purpose acquisition company (SPAC). Brand-new hedge fund XN returned <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/915caafc-6ccb-4fbf-a4d3-af5130d8a898?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">46% in its first five months</a>, in part by betting against an “ever-expanding crop of newly public companies,” founder Gaurav Kapadia told the Financial Times.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> If XN’s strategy keeps working, it will be an outlier. Short-biased funds are on pace for their worst year on record. </p>

</a><span>  </span>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY THE MOTLEY FOOL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

Take the Money and Run

</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Actually, that has nothing to do with this ad. It’s just the song stuck in our heads atm.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’re here with another insightful article created with our friends at The Motley Fool that contains <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/10/etfs-everything-need-know" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">everything you need to know about ETFs</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Apparently these low-attention investments require a bit of attention before making any moves. They may have <strong style="color:#000">lower costs and higher tax efficiencies</strong> than mutual funds, but there’s way more to it than that.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There are <strong style="color:#000">three things we think you should know</strong> before you jump on the ETF train—and The Motley Fool let us in on <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/10/etfs-everything-need-know" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">what they are</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Hopefully you’ll make the money. And then maybe you can go on that run. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/10/etfs-everything-need-know" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Read our article here</a>.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/11/popping-ipo-market-broken?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Pop, Lock, and Plz Stop It
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">DoorDash and Airbnb both went public this week with massive stock price “pops.” On Day 1 of trading, DoorDash shares closed 85% above their initial price, while Airbnb’s rose more than 112% by market close.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">No first-day-of-school jitters in 2020</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Nineteen IPOs <a href="https://twitter.com/LesliePicker/status/1337200482612355074?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">doubled</a> their share prices on their first day of trading this year. In 2019, just three newly public companies did. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While popping may be good for Rice Krispies, it’s more than just spilled milk for pre-IPO shareholders. Just ask Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky, who won the award for “most shook” <a href="https://www.instagram.com/p/CIoM5DNAuHp/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">live on Bloomberg</a> yesterday. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>For Chesky, the gap between Airbnb’s debut share price of $68 and the $139/share it </span><span><em>actually</em></span><span> opened at translates to billions of dollars of missed opportunity (had the company initially sold its shares at that higher price).</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Plus, these first-day pops can make shares look soggy later. An inflated price that later drops off creates a Splash Mountain-style stock chart—not a great PowerPoint slide to show investors.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong><a href="https://www.barrons.com/articles/snowflake-showed-that-ipos-are-broken-heres-how-to-fix-them-51601681326?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more companies</a> could go public via SPAC mergers and direct listings, two alternatives to an IPO process some are calling “broken.”</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the South Korean automaker said it’s acquiring a <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/12/11/22167835/hyundai-boston-dynamics-aquisition-consumer-robotics?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">controlling stake</a> in Boston Dynamics, the robot maker with the internet-famous dog, Spot, for $1.1 billion. Whether you think Spot is oddly cute or straight out of <em>Black Mirror</em>’s “Metalhead” episode, he could be a very good buy (see what we did there?) to help Hyundai advance its autonomous technology capabilities. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some of the sectors Boston Dynamics’s tech might help with one day: self-driving vehicles, smart factories, and healthcare.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With Hollywood production disrupted and an escape from reality in high demand, shows about giant cannibal humanoids, high school superheroes, and demon-possessed sisters are having a heyday. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Over </span><span><strong style="color:#000">100 million </strong></span><span>households around the world watched anime on Netflix this year, and an anime title in Japan just grossed over </span><span><strong style="color:#000">$200 million</strong></span><span> at the box office.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sony saw this surge, said “ok bet,” and bought anime streaming service Crunchyroll from AT&T for $1.2 billion this week. What does it mean for the growing anime industry and the wider streaming wars? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Brew’s senior anime correspondent, Jamie Wilde, said, “What’s the point of having a senior anime correspondent if I don’t write an in-depth story on this?” So she did.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/11/sony-buys-crunchyroll-consolidates-big-business-bringing-japanese-anime-western-viewers?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Learn all about the anime industry here</a>.</p>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nFINANCE \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nFinance Joins the 305\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if mso]\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Pitbull\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; --\u003e\n\u003cimg class=\"story-header-image\" alt=\"Pitbull\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/3o7TKT7gSMOT8Thtss/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c!--\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGiphy\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf recent trends are any indication, bankers will be trading in their Patagonia vests for a flip flop tan. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Ken Moelis, the chairman and CEO of New York investment bank Moelis \u0026 Co., \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-11/moelis-gives-his-bankers-blessing-to-work-wherever-they-want?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold Bloomberg\u003c/a\u003e he wouldn't stop his employees from moving to Florida.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“We’re a talent business,” he said. “I want to attract, I want to motivate, and I want to retain the greatest talent in the world. And if that talent wants to do it in Florida, that’s where we’ll support them.”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMoelis’s comments echo a string of other reports that show momentum swinging from the Big Apple to the Big Orange.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eGoldman Sachs is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-06/goldman-plots-florida-base-for-asset-management-in-a-blow-to-nyc?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003escouting out\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Florida locations for its asset management arm, Bloomberg wrote last week.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003ePaul Singer’s hedge fund, Elliott Management, is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-10-21/singer-s-41-billion-hedge-fund-moving-headquarters-to-florida?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emoving its HQ\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to West Palm Beach from Midtown Manhattan, also according to Bloomberg. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhy now? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s not exactly a secret that Florida is warmer than New York, boasts a cheaper cost of living, and has world-class institutions like Publix. But banks have been hesitant to allow their operations to leak out of New York City because physical proximity was considered necessary for dealmaking. Then the pandemic hit, and showed that some parts of finance can be just as easily accomplished on Zoom as in physical boardrooms. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMoelis said his 128 managing directors landed $72 billion of M\u0026A deals since June 30—all without face-to-face meetings. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIt’s not just finance…\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd it’s not just New York bleeding business leaders. In an \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/elon-musk-to-discuss-teslas-banner-year-despite-pandemic-silicon-valleys-future-11607449988?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einterview with the WSJ\u003c/a\u003e this week, Tesla CEO Elon Musk confirmed rumors he had moved from California to Texas. Musk said the notoriously expensive Silicon Valley “has too much influence on the world,” and predicted the tech industry would reduce its footprint there. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eRight on cue, software giant Oracle said yesterday it was \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/12/11/oracle-is-moving-its-headquarters-from-silicon-valley-to-austin-texas.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emoving its HQ\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e from Redwood City, CA, to Austin, TX.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eNew York and SF have built world-leading business ecosystems. But their dominance could wane thanks to the pandemic’s disruption of office work and Americans’ shifting priorities around quality of life. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe impending Covid-19 vaccine rollout will give many sectors across Corporate America the opportunity to shine. Let’s take a quick tour. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRetail: \u003c/strong\u003eCVS and Walgreens have been tapped to administer vaccines at tens of thousands of long-term care facilities across the country, and CVS chief Larry Merlo told CNBC his company is “\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/12/10/cvs-health-has-10000-staffers-ready-to-vaccinate-seniors-at-nursing-homes.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eready to go\u003c/a\u003e.” Walmart’s been \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-10/walmart-adds-freezers-dry-ice-to-prepare-for-vaccine-rollout?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eadding\u003c/a\u003e cold storage capabilities to handle the vaccine at more than 5,000 of its pharmacies. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eShipping: \u003c/strong\u003eFedEx and UPS are carving up the U.S. like a Risk map as they prepare to rush the vaccine to administration sites. They’re \u003ca href=\"https://www.commercialappeal.com/story/money/industries/logistics/2020/12/10/covid-19-vaccine-latest-fedex-ups-shipping-distribution/3863534001/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econfident\u003c/a\u003e that together they have the capacity to deliver both the life-saving shot and the Christmas sweater you sent your aunt. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePharma: \u003c/strong\u003eTurns out, developing a vaccine that can help end a global pandemic can make you a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/12/11/business/pfizer-vaccine-covid-moderna-revenue/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elot of money\u003c/a\u003e. Pfizer and Moderna are expected to generate $32 billion in Covid-19 vaccine sales in 2021, according to Wall Street forecasts. But one cantankerous group of investors got crushed: short sellers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eA quick refresher: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShort sellers make money when a company loses value.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis year has been a roller coaster year for the Simon Cowells of the market. In March, when markets crashed, the short fund index posted its \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-11-11/moderna-s-covid-19-shot-is-next-on-deck-after-pfizer-s-success?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebiggest monthly gain ever\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut it’s been nothing but pain ever since. Two of the most popular targets for short sellers, Moderna and Tesla, have gained 702% and 629% this year, respectively, wiping out short sellers’ March profits. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eOne approach \u003cem\u003eis\u003c/em\u003e working\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTargeting companies like Nikola Motors that have recently gone public via a special purpose acquisition company (SPAC). Brand-new hedge fund XN returned \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/915caafc-6ccb-4fbf-a4d3-af5130d8a898?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e46% in its first five months\u003c/a\u003e, in part by betting against an “ever-expanding crop of newly public companies,” founder Gaurav Kapadia told the Financial Times.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e If XN’s strategy keeps working, it will be an outlier. class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edoubled\u003c/a\u003e their share prices on their first day of trading this year. In 2019, just three newly public companies did. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile popping may be good for Rice Krispies, it’s more than just spilled milk for pre-IPO shareholders. Just ask Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky, who won the award for “most shook” \u003ca href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CIoM5DNAuHp/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elive on Bloomberg\u003c/a\u003e yesterday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eFor Chesky, the gap between Airbnb’s debut share price of $68 and the $139/share it \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eactually\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e opened at translates to billions of dollars of missed opportunity (had the company initially sold its shares at that higher price).\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePlus, these first-day pops can make shares look soggy later. An inflated price that later drops off creates a Splash Mountain-style stock chart—not a great PowerPoint slide to show investors.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003e\u003ca style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore companies\u003c/a\u003e could go public via SPAC mergers and direct listings, two alternatives to an IPO process some are calling “broken.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:
